user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of new_connection_close_:
```c
static void
new_connection_close_ (struct MHD_Daemon *daemon,
                       struct MHD_Connection *connection)
{
  mhd_assert (connection->daemon == daemon);
  mhd_assert (! connection->in_cleanup);
  mhd_assert (NULL == connection->next);
  mhd_assert (NULL == connection->nextX);
#ifdef EPOLL_SUPPORT
  mhd_assert (NULL == connection->nextE);
#endif /* EPOLL_SUPPORT */

#ifdef HTTPS_SUPPORT
  if (NULL != connection->tls_session)
  {
    mhd_assert (0 != (daemon->options & MHD_USE_TLS));
    gnutls_deinit (connection->tls_session);
  }
#endif /* HTTPS_SUPPORT */
  MHD_socket_close_chk_ (connection->socket_fd);
  MHD_ip_limit_del (daemon,
                    connection->addr,
                    connection->addr_len);
  if (NULL != connection->addr)
    free (connection->addr);
  free (connection);
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: No unreachable code constructs were identified in this function. There are no return statements, goto labels, or loop constructs that would cause subsequent statements to be statically unreachable. Conditional blocks are controlled by runtime checks (e.g., if (NULL != connection->tls_session)) or by preprocessing macros (#ifdef HTTPS_SUPPORT, #ifdef EPOLL_SUPPORT); when those macros are not defined the corresponding code is not present in the translation unit (not statically unreachable), and when they are defined the guarded code is reachable at runtime depending on the condition. The mhd_assert calls are runtime assertions (typically no-ops in non-debug builds) and do not by themselves create statically unreachable code. Finally, the function ends after freeing connection and contains no statements following the free that would be unreachable. Therefore no code fragments in this function require further investigation for MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1.
